name.text: Determining the Stationary Points of a Parametric Function

questiontext.text:
{@make_multsgn("blank")@}

Determine the coordinates of the stationary points of the parametric function,

\(x={@xx@},\)   \(y = {@yy@}\)

Stationary Point 1: \( \big( \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] \(,\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] \( \big) \)

[[feedback:prt1]]

[[feedback:prt2]]

Stationary Point 2: \( \big( \) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] \(,\) [[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]] \( \big) \)

[[feedback:prt3]]

[[feedback:prt4]]

generalfeedback.text:
{@make_multsgn("blank")@}

Worked Solution

We first differentiate \(x\) with respect to \(t\):

\(x = {@aa*t^2@}\)

\(\frac{dx}{dt} = {@aa*2*t@}\)


Similarly, we differentiate \(y\) with respect to \(t\):

\(y = {@t^3-bb*t@}\)

\(\frac{dy}{dt} = {@3*t^2 - bb@}\)


Using the chain rule, we can determine the derivative of \(y\) with respect to \(x\).

\(\frac{dy}{dx} = \frac{dy}{dt} \cdot \frac{dt}{dx} = \frac{{@3*t^2 - bb@}}{{@aa*2*t@}}\)


To find stationary points we simply equate this derivative to 0 and solve for \(t\).

\(\frac{{@3*t^2 - bb@}}{{@aa*2*t@}} = 0\)

\({@3*t^2 - bb@} = 0\)

\({@t^2@} = \frac{{@bb@}}{3} = {@bb/3@}\)

\(t = \pm {@sqrt(bb/3)@}\)


Considering the positive case first, we obtain the coordinates for the first stationary point.

\(\begin{align*} x &= {@aa@}({@sqrt(bb/3)@})^2 & y &= {@sqrt(bb/3)@}^3 - {@bb@} {@sqrt(bb/3)@} \\ &= {@ratsimp(aa*sqrt(bb/3)^2)@} & &= {@bb/3@} {@sqrt(bb/3)@} - {@bb@} {@sqrt(bb/3)@} \\ & & &= {@(bb/3-bb)@} {@sqrt(bb/3)@} \end{align*}\)


Similarly, the negative case gives us the second stationary point.

\(\begin{align*} x &= {@aa@} (-{@sqrt(bb/3)@})^2 & y &= (-{@sqrt(bb/3)@})^3 - {@bb@} (-{@sqrt(bb/3)@}) \\ &= {@ratsimp(aa*sqrt(bb/3)^2)@} & &= {@-bb/3@} {@sqrt(bb/3)@} + {@bb@} {@sqrt(bb/3)@} \\ & & &= {@(-bb/3+bb)@} {@sqrt(bb/3)@} \end{align*}\)


Therefore, the stationary points are at \( ({@ratsimp(aa*sqrt(bb/3)^2)@}, {@(bb/3-bb)@} {@sqrt(bb/3)@}) \) and \( ({@ratsimp(aa*sqrt(bb/3)^2)@}, {@(-bb/3+bb)@} {@sqrt(bb/3)@}) \)

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

feedbackvariables.text: /* Node 1: Checks for the correct x coordinate of the stationary point */
/*Node 1: Checks for the correct y coordinate of the stationary point */ /*Node 2: Checks for the correct y coordinate of the stationary point */
/* Node 1: Checks if the student first x coordinate of the student is the same as the the second x cooredinate */ /* Node 2: Checks for the correct x coordinate of the stationary point */

truefeedback.text: The points are not the same, they are distinct.
The points are not the same, they are distinct.
